title: Nvidia’s next move: powering humanoid robots - TechCrunch
summary:
Nvidia's Next Move: Powering Humanoid Robots

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: TechCrunch

The chipmaking giant Nvidia is leaning more heavily into robotics in 2025, launching a new generation of compact computers for humanoid robots called Jetson Thor.

  • Nvidia is not directly competing with companies like Tesla but plans to support hundreds of thousands of robot manufacturers.
  • The shift is attributed to breakthroughs in generative AI models and training robots in simulated environments.
  • Major customers like Amazon and Google are developing their own AI chips, prompting Nvidia's strategic pivot.
“We provide hundreds of thousands of robot makers in the world with a kind of underlying OEM.” - Deepu Talla, VP of Robotics at Nvidia

Nvidia's entry into AI-powered robotics signifies a critical adaptation to current technological trends and customer needs.

title: American man reveals Indian CEO took over a firm, booted out founders, hired Indians. Post goes viral amid - The Economic Times
summary:
American man reveals Indian CEO took over a firm, booted out founders, hired Indians. Post goes viral amid

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Economic Times

The viral post by a U.S. attorney has sparked heated debates regarding the actions of an Indian CEO who allegedly displaced the company's founders and filled leadership roles with Indian executives amidst accusations of unfair treatment toward American employees.

  • The CEO allegedly took over a company acquired by a private equity firm.
  • Claims include a 10% pay cut for employees and a layoff of 15% of the staff, primarily affecting older employees.
  • Outsourcing of work to India resulted in a negative company culture and reduced client satisfaction.
  • The post has gained over 8 million views, prompting widespread discussion about immigration and workplace equity in tech.
  • Netizens shared personal stories of similar experiences with Indian executives, raising concerns about biased hiring practices.
“My ex worked for IBM and they would send employees to India to train their replacements,” - X user.

This incident illustrates the ongoing complexities and controversies surrounding immigration and diversity in workplaces, shedding light on broader issues of inclusion and fairness in corporate America.
newTitle: Viral Post Accuses Indian CEO of Displacing Founders and Biased Hiring Practices

title: Reliance pulls out an old video of a very young Mukesh Ambani from archives for Jamnagar refinery celebrations | Watch | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Reliance Celebrates 25 Years of Jamnagar Refinery with Historic Video of Mukesh Ambani

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Live Mint

Reliance Industries commemorated the 25th anniversary of its Jamnagar refinery by sharing an archival video of a young Mukesh Ambani discussing his father's vision.

“Jamnagar has demonstrated unquestionable to the world that if we can dream it, we can do it,” said Mukesh Ambani in the video.
  • The Jamnagar refinery was launched on December 28, 1999.
  • It currently produces 1.4 million barrels of crude oil per day.
  • The refinery contributes significantly to reducing India’s petroleum imports.
  • Reliance invested $3.5 billion in the refinery's initial development.
  • The refinery aims to achieve Net Zero emissions by 2035.

The company shared a post on X highlighting the refinery's groundbreaking innovations and construction milestones.
newTitle: Reliance Celebrates 25 Years of Jamnagar Refinery with Historic Video of Mukesh Ambani

This article highlights several stocks to watch on December 30, 2024, including significant developments in Reliance Infrastructure, JSW Energy, IOL Chemicals, and more.

  • Reliance Infrastructure: The company's unit received notices from Axis Bank and IDFC First Bank regarding alleged defaults on a concession agreement.
  • JSW Energy: Acquired O2 Power for ₹12,468 crore, increasing generation capacity by 23%.
  • IOL Chemicals: Announced a 1-for-5 stock split approved by its board.
  • Axis Max Life Insurance: Plans to discontinue operations of its pension fund management subsidiary.
  • Utkarsh Small Finance Bank: Will sell a portfolio of NPAs and written-off loans worth approximately ₹355 crore.
  • Hero MotoCorp: Extended partnership with Harley-Davidson for new motorcycle development.
“JSW Energy’s acquisition is its largest since inception, consolidating its position in the renewable energy sector.”

Google’s CEO warns ChatGPT may become synonymous to AI the way Google is to Search - Search Engine Land
summary:
Google's CEO warns ChatGPT may become synonymous to AI the way Google is to Search

Publication Date: December 27, 2024, Source: CNBC

Sundar Pichai, Google’s CEO, discussed the company's focus on AI for 2025 during a strategy meeting with employees, emphasizing the urgency and need for a faster and more innovative approach to compete.

  • Pichai highlighted the importance of scaling Gemini on the consumer side as a key goal for next year.
  • He expressed concerns about ChatGPT becoming the dominant brand associated with AI, similar to how Google is perceived regarding search.
  • Pichai presented a chart showcasing Gemini 1.5 leading OpenAI's GPT but indicated potential challenges ahead.
  • He encouraged a return to scrappy innovation reminiscent of early Google days to maintain competitive advantage.
“I think 2025 will be critical...The stakes are high. These are disruptive moments.”

This year is pivotal for major AI players, as they strive for market share and recognition in the fast-evolving AI landscape.
newTitle: Google's CEO warns ChatGPT may become synonymous to AI the way Google is to Search

title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu shares the #1 reason Indians have no respect globally: 'Achievments abroad is not - The Economic Times
summary:
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Why Indians Lack Global Respect

Publication Date: Not mentioned
Source: Not mentioned

Sridhar Vembu, CEO of Zoho Corporation, calls for self-reliance among Indians, emphasizing the need for indigenous innovation to tackle unique challenges and earn global respect.

  • Vembu stresses the importance of developing capabilities within India instead of relying on foreign achievements.
  • He advocates for building homegrown technologies tailored to India's needs.
  • Vembu highlights the necessity of addressing social inequalities for national development.
  • The CEO discusses the importance of retaining local talent for India's technological growth.
  • He questions the implications of prioritizing global rankings at the expense of local development.
“To earn true respect in the world, Indians have to develop deep capabilities in India. Achievements abroad won't do it.” - Sridhar Vembu

In conclusion, Vembu's message advocates for a shift towards self-reliance and inclusive growth, which he believes are essential for India’s sustainable progress.
newTitle: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Why Indians Lack Global Respect

summary:
Market Cap of 6 Top Firms Jumps ₹86,848 Crore, With HDFC Bank and RIL Leading Gains

Date: Dec 29, 2023   Source: PTI

Six of the top-10 most valued firms in India added ₹86,847.88 crore in market valuation last week, driven by strong performance from HDFC Bank and Reliance Industries as equity markets showed optimism.

  • Top gainers included HDFC Bank, Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank, Bharti Airtel, ITC, and Hindustan Unilever.
  • HDFC Bank's market capitalisation surged by ₹20,235.95 crore.
  • Reliance Industries added ₹20,230.9 crore, reaching a valuation of ₹16,52,235.07 crore.

Reliance Industries remains the most valued domestic firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, and others.

Report: ‘Scaling’ Gemini for consumers will be Google’s ‘biggest focus’ in 2025 - 9to5Google
summary:
Report: ‘Scaling’ Gemini for consumers will be Google’s ‘biggest focus’ in 2025

Date: December 27, 2024   Source: 9to5Google

Just before the holiday break, CEO Sundar Pichai and other Google executives outlined their 2025 strategy, emphasizing that scaling Gemini for consumers is their top priority.

  • Sundar Pichai announced that scaling Gemini on the consumer side will be their primary focus for 2025.
  • Google anticipates the Gemini app to become their next first-party application to reach half a billion monthly users.
  • Pichai highlighted the importance of execution, stating, “In history, you don’t always need to be first but you have to execute well and really be the best in class as a product.”
  • Google aims to 'turbo charge' the Gemini app to evolve products significantly over the next couple of years.
  • Project Astra, related to Gemini, aims to create a universal assistant across all domains and devices.

“Overall, we have some work to do in 2025 to close the gap and establish a leadership position there as well.”

The emphasis on Gemini as a driver for their growth reflects Google's commitment to integrating AI into their core applications.
newTitle: Google's 2025 Focus: Scaling Gemini for Consumers

Skoda India has launched its first compact SUV, the Kylaq, which has quickly gained popularity, surpassing 10,000 bookings within 10 days of its launch. This model offers great features at an attractive price point under Rs 10 Lakh.

  • Skoda Kylaq is based on the Kushaq and is a sub-4 meter compact SUV.

title: In Azerbaijan, South Korea air crashes, survivors in planes’ tail end: what studies say on seating, survival rate - The Indian Express
summary:
Title: Azerbaijan & South Korea Air Crashes: Rear Seats Show Higher Survival Rate

Date & Source: December 29, 2022, from Indian Express (Source: Link)

Introduction: Two fatal air crashes within a week in Azerbaijan and South Korea have sparked discussions about seating and survival rates. Most survivors were found in the tail end of planes.

  1. On December 25, an Azerbaijan Airlines flight crashed near Aktau, Kazakhstan, with 38 fatalities out of 67 passengers.
  2. On December 29, a Jeju Air plane crashed during an emergency landing in South Korea, with 180 fatalities out of 181 passengers, making it the worst aviation disaster in South Korea's history.
The rear third of aircraft had a 32% fatality rate compared to 39% in the middle and 38% in the front (Time magazine, 2015 study).

Conclusion: While air travel remains statistically safe, studies suggest that the rear of the plane, particularly middle seats, may offer slightly better survival odds in crashes.
newTitle: Azerbaijan & South Korea Air Crashes: Rear Seats Show Higher Survival Rate

title: Air Canada plane catches fire during landing at Halifax Airport; chilling video goes viral - The Indian Express
summary:
Air Canada Flight Makes Emergency Landing at Halifax Airport After Landing Gear Failure

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

A PAL Airlines aircraft, operating as Air Canada flight AC2259, made an emergency landing at Halifax Airport due to a landing gear failure.

  • The incident occurred at around 9:30 PM AT.
  • The aircraft tilted to the left at about a 20-degree angle during landing, creating a loud crashing sound.
  • Viral footage showed the wings of the plane striking the runway, which resulted in a fire.
  • There were no reported casualties among passengers or crew.
“The plane started to sit at about a 20-degree angle to the left and, as that happened, we heard a pretty loud — what almost sounded like a crash sound — as the wing of the plane started to skid along the pavement.” - Nikki Valentine

The incident has garnered significant social media attention, particularly in light of another recent aviation accident involving a crash in South Korea.
newTitle: Air Canada Flight Makes Emergency Landing at Halifax Airport After Landing Gear Failure
